intro: Solanum kioniotrichum, commonly known as the Kioniotrichum nightshade, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers, and is characterized by its showy, often violet or blue flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and alternate leaves. It produces small, berry-like fruits that are usually yellow or orange when mature. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
